steps.name: the Cluster Under Test is managed by ESXI
the Operating Systems of each node match what is configured
I revert the cluster to its configured "readyForInstallation" state
I wait "30" seconds
the cluster does not have MapR Installed

resultJSON.name: Installation
resultJSON.description:
As a Spyglass Customer
In order to install a Spyglass-enabled MapR Cluster
I use one of the following installation methods

steps.name: I follow the manual installation instructions located at "https://github.com/mapr/private-spyglass"

result.error_message:

steps.name: it tells me how to install, configure and run the services required for Spyglass
it tells me how to discover the URLs for MCS, Kibana, Grafana, OpenTSDB and ElasticSearch
the cluster does not have MapR Installed
I ssh into the node hosting "GUI Installer"
within my ssh session, I download "/mapr-setup.sh" to "/tmp" from the "GUI Installer" repo
within my ssh session, I execute "/tmp/mapr-setup.sh -y -u [installerRepoURL] [maprCoreRepoURL] [ecosystemRepoURL]"
I wait "15" seconds
it successfully starts the installer web server and outputs its URL to the screen

elements.name: Use REST APIs to Install MapR with Spyglass Components

steps.name: the GUI Installer web server is running
I can authenticate my GUI Installer Rest Client
I specify the desired Cluster Configuration
I perform Cluster Configuration Verification
Cluster Configuration Verification completes without errors
I perform Cluster Provisioning
Cluster Provisioning completes without errors
I perform Cluster Installation
Cluster Installation completes without errors

resultJSON.name: Test Transparency
resultJSON.description:
As a Spyglass Stakeholder
In order to ensure a high quality release
I desire to easily view current and past test statuses and connect that information to
JIRA, Github, and Google Sheets
